file_content.text: I'm putting in a requisition order for new equipment, today. A destroyed ion disruptor has to count for something.
I didn't need my lousy standard-issue scanner to see that explosion. Nice work!
Thanks.
I have business elsewhere.
And I've earned a reward.
Knew there had to be a catch somewhere. I hope this'll be enough for you--and thanks, I guess.
Next time, fix this yourself.
"Operational self-reliance," huh? The brass says that, too. We'll keep trying.
Oh hey--take this with you. Not every day someone goes out of their way for us.
Keep the Imperials off the ion disruptor once you've planted the bomb, or it's all for nothing.
You know how hard it is to get decent equipment out here? Hmm, I guess not--all you Jedi need is a lightsaber.
Be grateful you're Havoc Squad, sir. Special Forces are always prioritized for new gear; we're lucky to get equipment once a month.
Hmph. Let me guess, independent starship captain? I bet you never have trouble getting the equipment you need, huh?
Take my advice, all of you. Conserve your equipment while you've got it. We're lucky to get resupplied once a month.
We were sent diagnostic gear, to find those big crystal deposits, but the blasted Empire's set up an ion disruptor nearby.
That disruptor fries our diagnostic systems, no one sends us proper shielding.... The Empire's going to get those crystal deposits first, all because we're "lower priority."
You could go on the offensive.
That diagnostic equipment is what matters, Master Jedi; it can only take so much damage.
The Republic wouldn't do this.
The sacrifices have to be made somewhere, Master Jedi. We make do--most of the time.
If you want to be treated like the best, Captain, prove you're worth it.
Make yourself high priority.
I'm doing my best, sir, but you know what it's like, doing operations on shoestring resources.
Stuck with bureaucrats, eh?
And even when I can see a way out, something else goes wrong.
Get rid of the Empire's ion disruptor, and it won't matter what priority you are.
The disruptor is the problem.
I've been trying to trash that thing, believe me.
Complain to someone else.
Just hoping for a sympathetic ear.
I cobbled together a bomb to destroy the disruptor, but the Empire has some of their best technicians on site. They'll only defuse it before it goes off.
Not if I stop them.
Really? Huh. Never thought anyone'd care about us.
How do you use this bomb?
If you're serious about helping, just find the ion disruptor and plant the bomb; it self-activates.
The real problem is the Imperials. Keep them away from the bomb or they'll shut it off. But you can handle them, right?
I have to go. [Refuse quest]
When will they get it? We can't find their crystals if they don't give us the tools!
Blasted Imperials and their gadgets. This is a losing battle.
